segments.text: I see the boy is really struggling to reach that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's stretching as high as he can, but it's just out of his reach.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit frustrated for him; he's so close but can't quite get it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is eagerly waiting for him to pass her a cookie, but it's not looking promising.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they might have to come up with a new plan to get those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still completely oblivious to what's happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find it a bit amusing that she hasn't noticed the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like she's in her own little world, polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the children don't make too much of a mess trying to get those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what they'll do if they can't reach the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they might have to wait until the woman is done with the dishes and can get the cookies for them.
segments.speaker: PAR
